results.title: Phiguring out acids and bases
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Examines the acids and bases in everyday use and develops the idea of ph measurment both quantitatively and qualitatively as a measure of concentration.This program presents historical developments of the proton/theory and pH notation. Practical applications of pH testing and adjustments are also covered.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shane Mulcahy, Deborah Lawther, Glen Foster, Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Some are more equal than others
results.creator_credit: Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Briefly traces the history of the development of equal opportunity. A representative from the Equal Opportunity Board and the Youth Affairs Council discuss the equal opportunity legislation and how it affects youth.

results.title: New jig technology
results.creator_credit: Adrian Harvey, Bruce Shearer and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: A program for employees and trainees in the automotive repair industry which looks at the development of two new automotive body repair technologies- dedicated jig systems and universal measuring systems. Both are fully explained and the advantages and disadvantages of each discussed.

results.title: Momentum: a crash course
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Jim Joyce, Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Uses simple collision between ice-skaters and gliders on an air track to develop the concepts of momentum and impulse and shows how these can be used in conjunction with the principles of conservation of momentim to analyse the changes in motion that occur in collisions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shane Mulcahy, Jim Joyce, Trish Pilley and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education

results.title: Metal makers
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the mining and processing of copper, silver, lead and zinc at Mt. Isa, one of the world’s largest underground mines. Covers such aspects as the operation of the mine, mining techniques, mineral extractions and smelting, refining and distribution of the processed metal. Uses of the various metals are illustrated. Quality and pollution controls are also explained. The importance of Mt. Isa as a large inland city is also stressed.
results.description: A detailed examination of the mining and processing of copper, silver, lead and zinc at Mt. Isa, one of the world’s largest underground mines. Covers such aspects as the operation of the mine, mining techniques, mineral extractions and smelting, refining and distribution of the processed metal. Uses of the various metals are illustrated. Quality and pollution controls are also explained. The importance of Mt. Isa as a large inland city is also stressed.

results.title: Women working in the media
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Pat Walter, a video camera operator, Julie Copeland, a radio broadcaster and producer, and Lina Caneva, a TV and radio journalist, discuss their experiences as women working in the male-dominated TV and radio industry.

results.title: Countering sexism
results.creator_credit: Don Fitzsimmons, Julie Sheehan, Sabina Baltrukomis and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: A compilation tape of four programmes addressing various aspects of sex discrimination. The episodes highlight women working in the media, the importance of gender inclusive curriculum, girls and science and sexual harrassment in schools.

results.title: Social enquiry: questions, answers and action
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Looks at two classes, one at year 4 and one at year 10, engaged in effective enquiry learning. Both are investigating local issues involving the environment, plus the decision making processes that enable change to take place. Different stages of the enquiry sequence are featured which allow observations to be made about teaching strategies and the learning processes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Scarfe and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

results.title: 'Way to go'
results.brief_description: Overviews school camps and excursions. Explains who is responsible for these events, the planning and approvals required prior to the trip, teacher and student preparation and legal and safety requirements.
